data.title: Rick Rubin
data.text:
Today in Hip-Hop History: The Beastie Boys’ Dropped Their Sophomore LP ‘Licensed To Ill’ 37 Years Ago

On this date 37 years ago, Adam Horowitz (Ad Rock), Adam Yauch (MCA), and Michael Diamond (Mike D) aka The Beastie Boys, dropped their sophomore LP Licensed To Ill, on the Def Jam Imprint under Columbia Records. Visit streaming.thesource.com for more information On the heels of the successful LL Cool J Radio album and the cult […]

Today In Hip Hop History: Jay-Z’s ‘The Black Album’ Turns 20 Years Old!

On this day in Hip-Hop history, Brooklyn’s own Jay-Z released he would-be retirement album The Black Album. Although there was virtually no pause between The Black Album and new Jay-Z music (collaboration albums with both R. Kelly and Linkin Park were released the following year), this album is easily the greatest retirement project of all time. Visit streaming.thesource.com for […]

Today in Hip-Hop History: Hip Hop Cult Classic Flick ‘Krush Groove’ Released In Theaters 38 Years Ago

On this date in 1985, Hip-Hop bigwig Russell Simmons along with film producer Michael Schultz unveiled the Hip-Hop glory days fairy tale about the early days of Def Jam in the Warner Brothers distributed Krush Groove. Visit streaming.thesource.com for more information This cinematic, quasi-musical was told in a very unique manner, with almost all of […]

Chuck D Defends Rick Rubin Saying He Knows Nothing About Music, ‘Art Should Come Out of You. He Gets That’

Last week, legendary producer Rick Rubin’s interview with Anderson Cooper was released. The interview caught many people’s attention after the Def Jam co-founder and pioneers of hip-hop admitted to knowing nothing about music. Visit streaming.thesource.com for more information “No. I have no technical ability. I know nothing about music,” Rubin told said on 60 Minutes. […]

Today in Hip-Hop History: LL Cool J Dropped His Debut Album ‘Radio’ 37 Years Ago

On this date in 1985, James Todd Smith better known as LL Cool J dropped his first full-length LP on Def Jam Records. Primarily produced by Rick Rubin besides “I Need A Beat”, which was produced by DJ Jazzy Jay, Radio was a pivotal LP for not only LL and Def Jam, but for an […]

On this date in 1988, what some consider one of the best years in Hip Hop, Run-D.M.C. and Jam Master Jay released their fourth full-length studio album Tougher Than Leather on the Profile imprint. [WATCH] Rick Rubin Interviews Mike D And Ad Rock Of The Beastie Boys For ‘Broken Record’ Podcast

It’s been almost 35 years since the Beastie Boys released the all-time classic, Licensed to Ill. And while some of the record’s lyrics and antics sound dated, the album is still exceptional. Visit streaming.thesource.com for more information For Beastie Boys fans, Licensed to Ill is a glimpse into the lives of MCA, Ad-Rock, Mike D […]

[LISTEN] Rick Rubin Sits Down With The Wu Tang Clan’s RZA For The ‘Broken Record’ Podcast

Yesterday, the Broken Record podcast will be dropping an episode featuring Rick Rubin’s interview with rapper, record producer, actor, filmmaker, and author, the Wu Tang Clan’s RZA. The Wu Tang Abbott delves into his early production memories, how his substance indulgence influences his creative output and the radio station that made a name based off of the […]

‘Beastie Boys Story’ Documentary Released On Apple TV Today

Legendary New York group the Beastie Boys have today released their long-awaited live documentary directed by Spike Jonze on Apple TV titled Beastie Boys Story. Visit streaming.thesource.com for more information The innovate near 2-hour stage performance of Mike D and Ad-Rock runs through the iconic groups’ pre-history from the early 1980s until today from their […]

Today in Hip-Hop History: RUN-D.M.C.’s Sophomore LP ‘King Of Rock’ Turns 35!

The “Kings From Queens” dropped their second album 35 years ago today. Visit streaming.thesource.com for more information On this date in 1985, Joseph Simmons, Daryl McDaniels, and Jason Mizell successfully avoided the sophomore jinx over three decades ago when they released the follow up to their self-titled debut album with King Of Rock. Produced by […]

Today in Hip Hop History: Run-D.M.C. Drops ‘Christmas in Hollis’ Single 32 Years Ago

On this day 32 years ago, Run-D.M.C. released their holiday-themed single “Christmas in Hollis”. The song was originally featured on the star-studded charity compilation album, A Very Special Christmas alongside the likes of Whitney Houston, Madonna, and Stevie Nicks to name a few. Produced by Run-D.M.C. and Rick Rubin, this track has become a Christmas […]
